fr.upmc.components

Interface ComponentI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractComponent, AbstractPlugin.Fake, ArrayBlockingQueue, ClientComponentSynchronized, ClientComponentSynchronized, ClientComponentSynchronized, ClientComponentSynchronized, CountDownLatch, CyclicBarrier, DistributedSynchronizerManager, DynamicAssembler, DynamicComponentCreator, DynamicURIConsumer, Semaphore, SynchronizerManager, TupleSpace, URIConsumer, URIProvider

    public interface ComponentI
    The interface ComponentI serves as common supertype for all classes that implements components in this component model.

    Description

    Components offer and require interfaces, and they provide methods to retrieve their required and offered interfaces represented as instances of Class. Components have ports that are used to connect them together through their interfaces. Outbound ports expose required interfaces, while inbound ones expose the offered interfaces. Components can also be queried for the ports that expose some given interface. The model include both sequential and concurrent components. As the concurrent ones rely on the Java Executor framework to handle requests with a pool of threads, both sequential and concurrent share the same protocol to execute requests: a handleRequest method capable of executing a Callable task. Tasks then call methods on the object that implement the component; these methods represent the services that the component offers.

    Created on : 2012-11-06

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  ComponentI.ComponentService<V>
      The interface ComponentService is meant to group under a same interface all of the requests that return results for this component.
      static interface  ComponentI.ComponentTask
      The interface ComponentTask is meant to group under a same interface all of the tasks for this component.

      <T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> handleRequest(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request)
      execute a request represented by a Callable on the component.
      <T> void handleRequestAsync(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request)
      execute a request represented by a ComponentService on the component, but asynchronously, i.e. without waiting for the result but returning the control immediately to the caller.
      <T> T handleRequestSync(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request)
      execute a request represented by a Callable on the component, but synchronously, i.e. waiting for the result and returning it to the caller.

      schedule a service for execution after a given delay.
      void scheduleRequestAsync(ComponentI.ComponentService<?> request, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
      schedule a service for execution after a given delay, without making the caller wait of giving it a possibility to synchronise with the result.
      <T> T scheduleRequestSync(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
      schedule a service for execution after a given delay, forcing the caller to wait for the result.
      java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> scheduleTask(ComponentI.ComponentTask t, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
      schedule a task to be run after a given delay.
      java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> scheduleTaskAtFixedRate(ComponentI.ComponentTask t, long initialDelay, long period, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
      schedule a task that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given period; that is executions will commence after initialDelay then initialDelay+period, then initialDelay + 2 * period, and so on.
      java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> scheduleTaskWithFixedDelay(ComponentI.ComponentTask t, long initialDelay, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
      schedule a task that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given delay between the termination of one execution and the commencement of the next.

      • awaitTermination

        boolean awaitTermination(long timeout,
                         java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        wait for the termination of the component; inspired from the Java Executor framework.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait.
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument.
        Returns:
        true if this executor terminated and false if the timeout elapsed before termination.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting.

        a Future representing pending completion of the task.

      • scheduleTask

        java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> scheduleTask(ComponentI.ComponentTask t,
                                                     long delay,
                                                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
        schedule a task to be run after a given delay.

        Contract

         pre    this.isInStateAmong(new ComponentStateI[]{ComponentState.STARTED})
 pre    this.canScheduleTasks()
 pre    t != null && delay > 0 && u != null
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        t - task to be scheduled.
        delay - delay after which the task must be run.
        u - time unit in which the delay is expressed.
        Returns:
        a ScheduledFuture representing pending completion of the task, and whose get() method will throw an exception upon cancellation.

      • scheduleTaskAtFixedRate

        java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> scheduleTaskAtFixedRate(ComponentI.ComponentTask t,
                                                                long initialDelay,
                                                                long period,
                                                                java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
        schedule a task that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given period; that is executions will commence after initialDelay then initialDelay+period, then initialDelay + 2 * period, and so on. If any execution of the task encounters an exception, subsequent executions are suppressed. Otherwise, the task will only terminate via cancellation or termination of the executor. If any execution of this task takes longer than its period, then subsequent executions may start late, but will not concurrently execute.

        Contract

         pre    this.isInStateAmong(new ComponentStateI[]{ComponentState.STARTED})
 pre    this.canScheduleTasks()
 pre    t != null && initialDelay >= 0 && period > 0 && u != null
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        t - task to be scheduled.
        initialDelay - delay after which the task begins to run.
        period - period between successive executions.
        u - time unit in which the initial delay and the period are expressed.
        Returns:
        a ScheduledFuture representing pending completion of the task, and whose get() method will throw an exception upon cancellation.

      • scheduleTaskWithFixedDelay

        java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> scheduleTaskWithFixedDelay(ComponentI.ComponentTask t,
                                                                   long initialDelay,
                                                                   long delay,
                                                                   java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
        schedule a task that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given delay between the termination of one execution and the commencement of the next. If any execution of the task encounters an exception, subsequent executions are suppressed. Otherwise, the task will only terminate via cancellation or termination of the executor.

        Contract

         pre    this.isInStateAmong(new ComponentStateI[]{ComponentState.STARTED})
 pre    this.canScheduleTasks()
 pre    t != null && initialDelay >= 0 && delay >= 0 && u != null
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        t - task to be scheduled.
        initialDelay - delay after which the task begins to run.
        delay - delay between the termination of one execution and the beginning of the next.
        u - time unit in which the initial delay and the delay are expressed.
        Returns:
        a ScheduledFuture representing pending completion of the task, and whose get() method will throw an exception upon cancellation.
        Throws:
        RejectedExecutionException - if the task cannot be scheduled for execution

      • handleRequest

        <T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> handleRequest(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        execute a request represented by a Callable on the component.

        Description

        Uniform API entry to execute a call on the component. The call, that represents a method call on the object representing the component, is embedded in a Callable object. In concurrent components, the Java executor framework is used to handle such requests. Sequential components may simply use this method to handle requests, or they may bypass it by directly calling the method on the object representing the component for the sought of efficiency.

        Contract

         pre    this.isInStateAmong(new ComponentStateI[]{ComponentState.STARTED})
 pre    task != null
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        request - service request to be executed on the component.
        Returns:
        a future value embedding the result of the task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if exception raised by the task.

      • handleRequestSync

        <T> T handleRequestSync(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        execute a request represented by a Callable on the component, but synchronously, i.e. waiting for the result and returning it to the caller.

        Contract

         pre    this.isInStateAmong(new ComponentStateI[]{ComponentState.STARTED})
 pre    task != null
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        request - service request to be executed on the component.
        Returns:
        the result of the task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if exception raised by the task.

      • handleRequestAsync

        <T> void handleRequestAsync(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        execute a request represented by a ComponentService on the component, but asynchronously, i.e. without waiting for the result but returning the control immediately to the caller. TODO: introduce distributed future variables to return a future value.

 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • scheduleRequest

        <T> java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<T> scheduleRequest(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request,
                                                            long delay,
                                                            java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
        schedule a service for execution after a given delay.

        Contract

         pre    this.isInStateAmong(new ComponentStateI[]{ComponentState.STARTED})
 pre    this.canScheduleTasks()
 pre    s != null && delay > 0 && u != null
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        request - service request to be scheduled.
        delay - delay after which the task must be run.
        u - time unit in which the delay is expressed.

      • scheduleRequestSync

        <T> T scheduleRequestSync(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request,
                          long delay,
                          java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                          java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        schedule a service for execution after a given delay, forcing the caller to wait for the result.

      • scheduleRequestAsync
